description: The Secretary of Health in Durango Mexico,  on August 27, 2020, urged the population to avoid panic purchases, shortages of some pre-established treatments. The SSD determined that the sale and administration of pharmaceutical products for the management of outpatients with the COVID-19 virus should be carried out only with the corresponding medical prescription, issued by the treating physician and retained by the establishment that supplies it.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
The Ministry of Education and FP and RTVE launch 'We learn at home' (Aprendemos en casa) to facilitate the learning of all students ages 6-16 during the suspension of face-to-face classes on March 23, 2020.
'We learn at home' is a 5-hour a day special television program promoted by the MEFP to alleviate the lack of face-to-face classes motivated by the coronavirus crisis, especially among the most socially vulnerable students.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 14, 2020, the Mexican health and education ministries announced to extend the school break and close schools from March 23rd to April 17th, with classes resuming on Monday, April 20th. The measure affects all educational levels. This coming year, schools will remain closed and students will learn from home with the "aprende en casa" program until states enter the "green" level of the stoplight system. The school year ends July 9, 2021.

type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down

description: On May 13, 2020, the Mexican President presented a recovery plan and confirmed that "269 municipalities are in a position to resume their activities, including school activities. The plan includes the creation of the 'Municipality of Hope', where they will return to classes as of May 18." These municipalities included Chiapas, Chihuahua, Guanajuato, Guerrero, Hidalgo, Jalisco, Michoacán, Nuevo León, Oaxaca, Puebla, San Luis Potosí, Sonora, Tamaulipas, Veracruz, and Yucatán.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with no conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Governor José Rosas Aispuro Torres of Durango, Mexico announced on August 24, 2020, a new education project, based on the second stage of Learn at Home, with the challenge of continuing the educational process for 541,000 girls, boys, youth, and 35,000 teachers, in the midst of the COVID-19 health pandemic. During this school year, there will be more than 4,500 television and 600 radio programs produced in indigenous languages ​​so that in the most remote locations, students can take their classes and on some occasions, a teacher will visit.

description:
On May 29, the Mexican government began the Stoplight System (Semáforo) as a way to return to the "new" normal. 

The Red (Rojo) stoplight only permits essential economic activities, and people are allowed to go for walks around their homes during the day.  This is the most restrictive level.

The Orange (Naranja) level allows essential economic activities, non-essential activities will be allowed to work with 30% of staff for operation, always taking into account maximum care measures for persons most at risk of presenting a severe COVID-19 table, open public spaces with a reduced capacity (number of people).

The Yellow (Amarillo) phase allows all work activities, taking care of people most at risk of developing a severe COVID-19. The outdoor public spaces will be open on a regular basis, and indoor public spaces can be opened with a reduced capacity. As in other traffic light colours, these activities should be carried out with basic prevention measures and maximum care for people at higher risk of developing a severe COVID-19 frame.

The Green (verde) phase allows all activities, including schools to resume.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On May 29, 2020 the Mexican Ministry of Health announced that it "has implemented a series of measures to ensure not only the highest level of specialized medical care in the area of psychiatric care and mental health in the six units under its authority, but also the prevention and mitigation of risks of contagion in the face of the health emergency which includes an installation of screens at all entrances to each medical unit to detect suspicious cases. The six units are: Children's Psychiatric Hospital "Dr. Juan N. Navarro," "Fray Bernardino Alvarez" Psychiatric Hospital, "Samuel Ramírez Moreno" Psychiatric Hospital, the Community Mental Health Centers Cuauhtémoc, Iztapalapa and Zacatenco. The measures include: Operation of the Committee for the Detection and Control of Nosocomial Infections (Codecin); dissemination and compliance with existing provisions; installing filters on all accesses of each medical unit to detect suspicious cases; placement of information posters; request for essential supplies such as sanitizing gel, antibacterial soap, bottle covers and gloves; as well as restricting the number of inpatient visits and reducing access to restricting the number of inpatient visits and reducing patient escort access to outpatient services, to name a few."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: A snapshot of a person’s health at a given point in time
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People with certain health conditions (please note which health conditions in the text entry)

description: "On June 1, the Mexican government began phasing in non-essential economic activities in some states and municipalities using a national “stoplight” (Semáforo) system.  The four metrics to determine the colors in the Mexican government’s stoplight system are the trend in numbers of new cases; hospital occupancy trends; current hospital occupancy rates; and percentage of positive cases.  If one indicator is red, the whole state will be designated red.  The Mexican government will update the state-level designations every Friday, and the revisions will take effect the following Monday."

description:
On July 3rd 2020, Guerrero was re-categorized as "Orange" in the traffic light system (Semáforo Epidemiológico). It was planned to stay in this phase for 15 days before changing to the "Yellow" category.

On August 31st 2020, Guerrero was finally promoted to the "Yellow" category, which led to the end of this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: As of July 3 2020, 15 states declared their risk of Covid was the Red (Maximum) part of the Traffic Light Monitoring System.  The "Red" risk only allows "essential economic activities...and people will be limited to move outside their homes during the day."  Those states are: Baja California, Chiapas, Coahuila, Colima, Estado de México, Guanajuato, Nayarit, Nuevo León, Puebla, Sinaloa, Sonora, Tabasco, Tamaulipas, Tlaxcala, and Veracruz.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of July 3, 2020, 17 states declared their risk was the Orange (High)  part of the Traffic Light Monitoring System. The "orange" risk states that "in addition to essential economic activities, companies with nonessential economic activities may conduct operations with 30% of their personnel, always taking into account the greatest degree of care for people with the highest risk (High Risk individuals) of presenting severe COVID-19-related symptoms.  Public spaces will be reopened with reduced capacity." Those states are: Aguascalientes, Baja California Sur, Campeche, Chihuahua, Mexico City, Durango, Guerrero, Hildago, Jalisco, Michoacán, Morelos, Oaxaca, Querétaro, Quintana Roo, San Luis Potosí, Yucatán, and Zacatecas.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

The new facilities have set aside 200 beds for COVID-19 patients in serious condition.

description: The government of Chihuahua state, Mexico, announced on March 26, 2020 that they want all medical, nursing and emergency medical personnel to voluntarily join the work and actions of the Ministry of Health. Those interested must have a valid professional license, be under 60 years of age, have good health and have a vocation for service to cover the jobs and tasks assigned to them as part of the contingency. Volunteers will be trained.

description: On April 2, 2020, the Mexican ministries of tourism and health agreed on certain measures, which include that the ministry of tourism in cooperation with the hotel industry "will prepare a list of lodging centres designed to concentrate all national and foreign guests with respiratory symptoms, and another for foreign guests without respiratory symptoms, while they await the support of their respective governments for their return."

description: On August 5, The United Kingdom and Mexico hosted the virtual seminar “Accelerating access to COVID-19 vaccines in Latin America and the Caribbean." At this seminar, they discussed "the importance of the Access to COVID-19 Tools (ACT) Accelerator to ensure global access to vaccines, treatments and tests to face COVID-19... the need for collaboration between governments, international institutions and businesses." Specifically, Mexico Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard said: 'Mexico seeks to bring the governments of Latin America and the Caribbean closer to the leading multilateral institutions in the strategy for the development and distribution of the vaccine against COVID-19, in order to guarantee equitable access. We appreciate the support of the UK in opening spaces for dialogue and building inclusive responses to global problems.'
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
target_region: Latin America,Central America,Other Regions (please specify below)

description:
In Durango state, Mexico, Governor José Rosas Aispuro Torres announced on August 26, 2020 investments made towards fighting against COVID-19.
The General Hospital of Gómez Palacio was put into operation with an investment of more than 1,100 million pesos; 70.8 million pesos were disbursed in supplies and medical supplies necessary for the operation of the units in the event of the contingency. In addition, the Call Center was enabled, which made 221 thousand calls to people to detect positive cases; Permanent and temporary personnel were hired with an extraordinary investment of 46.6 million pesos;  11.5 million pesos for the 450 Hospital in Durango, the Santiago Papasquiaro Hospital and the Lerdo Hospital isolation capsules, mobile virus detection units, beds, and monitors were acquired for the care of COVID patients.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: The federal Health Ministry of Mexico said on April 7 that a properly disinfected Covid-19 cadaver “poses no risk” and that the preferable way to dispose of one is cremation, but interment also acceptable. All ceremonies can follow traditional customs.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description: Health workers in México state, Mexico, who come into contact from April 7 with a COVID-19 cadaver will be equipped with a hermetically sealed disposable biohazard suit with goggles and an N-95 face mask. They will have to follow a strict hygiene protocol and completely clean and sanitize all areas and equipment used to deal with the remains.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description: Starting April 7, 2020 in Coahuila, the health personnel that attend and deliver corpses who were confirmed or suspected to have died from COVID-19 must wear gloves, face protection, and long-sleeved waterproof gowns.  These elements should be removed immediately and not reused as a hygiene measure.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Essential workers (please note their occuption in the text entry where applicable)

description: Hidalgo, Mexico, mandates on April 7 that cadavers be put into sanitary biodegradable bags clearly labeled as biohazards and that they be buried in coffins that are resistant to pressure caused by gas.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description: The Tabasco, Mexico, state Health Ministry prohibits from April 7 citizens from holding wakes in their homes and mandated that cadavers be cremated in sealed coffins within 12 hours of death.

description:
Chihuahua state, Mexico: On March 27, 2020, the state government with the State Commission for Indigenous Peoples (Coepi), COVID-19 messages were translated into the Ralamuli, Mazahua and Odami indigenous languages, so that the entire state territory has validated and timely information.

These messages are broadcast on radio and in printed materials, which are distributed directly to people in the settlements.

In addition, through the State Coordination of Interculturality in Health, audiovisual material was recorded that is disseminated through social networks and messages via WhatsApp, to reach the settlements that have an Internet connection.

description: On March 14, 2020 "the Ministry of Health recommends temporarily suspending non-essential activities in the public, social and private sectors as of Monday, March 23, 2020. The scope of this measure is national, this recommendation is nationwide, at the federal, state and municipal levels. On March 30, 2020, the General Health Council (GHC) ordered " the immediate suspension of non-essential activities in the public from 30 March to 30 April 2020, private and social sectors" in Mexico. On April 21, the Mexican General Health Council (CSG) announced that the suspension of non-essential activities is suspended until May 17. UPDATE: The original suspension of non-essential private activities was extended from April 30 to May 17.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Mexico, Sinaloa - in the city Mazatlán comercial stores and recreational spaces are closed. 

From June 17 and then on June 23, the government of Mazatlán announced a gradual reopening of the economy that went into effect on Tuesday. 

Officials announced that a variety of businesses could officially resume operations, including office supply stores, car washes, paint shops, auto parts stores and beauty salons, although in the case of the latter by appointment only.

description: The Ministry of Health of Baja California Sur, "developed this weekend, a verification day in fixed establishments selling food in beach areas of the municipality of La Paz, with the objective of verifying the strong application of mandatory measures for the prevention of the new coronavirus." This includes: filling out a self-assessment card, implementation of sanitary filters in the entrances, reducing capacity to 30 percent and the distancing of tables, the disinfection, and cleaning of areas for the conservation and preparation of food, the monitoring of personal hygiene measures, the implementation of a disinfection program for common use areas, as well as compliance with specific provisions for the handling of groceries, as is the indication that all hot and cold foods must be covered from the kitchen, with a hood or with aluminum foil."

description: On October 25, 2020, the Goverment of Mexico announced 19 states would be coded as "orange" in the Semáforo system, for the following states: Aguascalientes,, Baja California, Baja California Sur, Coahuila, Colima, Durango, Guerrero, Hidalgo, Jalisco, Mexico City, Mexico State, Michoacán, Nayarit, Nuevo Leon, Quertaro, Quintana Roo,San Luis Potasa, Yucatan and Zacatecas.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Under orange, hotels, restaurants, barber shops, open-air parks, and gyms are limited to 50 percent capacity. Markets and supermarkets will operate at 75 percent capacity. Additionally, shopping malls, churches, cinemas, theaters, museums, and cultural events will be limited to 25 percent capacity. This goes into effect until November 9.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

Grocery stores, supermarkets, and flea markets will have a maximum capacity of 30% and must be closed before 6 PM. UPDATE: Initially, the colour red in the Semáforo System for Hidalgo was to last at least until January 31st. The policy was extended and will continue until at least February 14th. Nightclubs, bars, games centers, bowling alleys, and children's play areas will remain closed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 18, 2021, the Hidalgo government moved the state to the colour red in the Semáforo System. Hotels and other lodging establishments will have a maximum capacity of 25%. Common areas must be closed and hotel food service must be restricted to individual rooms. This will remain tentatively until at least January 31. UPDATE: Initially, the colour red in the Semáforo System for Hidalgo was to last at least until January 31st. The policy was extended and will continue until at least February 14th. Restrictions for hotels and other lodging establishments will remain the same.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Paid lodgings (e.g. hotels; motels)") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Hygiene and sanitation measures required,Restriction of number of customers,Other condition not specified above (please provide detail in the text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 18, 2021, the Hidalgo government moved the state to the colour red in the Semáforo System. Restaurants and cafeterias will only have takeout. Only one person per family may enter the restaurant to pick up food at a time. Delivery of food will be prioritized. Restaurants must also be closed by 6 PM. This will remain tentatively until at least January 31. UPDATE: Initially, the colour red in the Semáforo System for Hidalgo was to last at least until January 31st. The policy was extended and will continue until at least February 14th. Restrictions for restaurants and cafeterias will remain the same.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of business hours (if applicable note the hours of business in text entry),Delivery and Takeaway Only
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 18, 2021, the Hidalgo government moved the state to the colour red in the Semáforo System. Grocery stores, supermarkets, and flea markets will have a maximum capacity of 30% and must be closed before 6 PM. In addition, children under 5 years old may not enter, and those over 5 years old must wear a mask. Only 1 member per family may enter at a time. This will remain tentatively until at least January 31. UPDATE: This policy ended on Februrary 14, 2021 when the Hidalgo government moved the state to the colour orange in the Semáforo System.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Supermarkets/grocery stores") is allowed to open with conditions

description: On January 25, 2021, the state of San Luis Potosí returned to the colour red in the Semáforo System. This included the closing of religious centers, public ballrooms and gardens, sports fields, cinemas and theaters, nightclubs, bars, casinos, and tourist parks and spas. UPDATE: This policy ended on Februrary 15, 2021 when the San Luis Potosí government and the Secretary of Health moved the state to the colour orange in the Semáforo System.

description:
On June the 1, 2020, the government of Mexico City published the fifth Agreement by which the terms and deadlines inherent to administrative procedures and formalities are suspended and administrative facilities are granted to comply with tax obligations, to prevent the spread of COVID-19 UPDATE: The update of the policy added the "First BIS Article" in which take into account the audit, interventions, internal control and delivery-reception activities carried out, in exercise of their powers, by the Secretariat of the Comptroller General of Mexico City, its Administrative Units, Administrative Units of Technical-Operational Support and the Internal Bodies of Control that are attached to it.

The Secretariat of the Comptroller General of Mexico City will continue to receive complaints for acts or omissions that contravene the legal order of Mexico City, through the citizen complaint system, available at the following electronic address:

description: On March 30, 2020, the General Health Council declared a national health emergency which includes that in "sectors identified as essential, meetings of no more than 50 persons should be held and basic measures of hygiene, prevention and healthy distance should always be applied" in Mexico. description: Starting April 23 2020 Mexico State Edomex expanded the “Hoy No Circula” program in an effort to reduce mobility within Mexico State. The "Hoy No Circula" program is a pre-existing program (pre-pandemic times) that aimed to reduce auto emissions by limiting the circulation of vehicles according to a sticker and number on their license plate on specific days, with some exceptions. On April 23, Edomex expanded the program such that the exceptions to the program were removed in an effort to reduce mobility within the state in response to the pandemic.

description:
Beginning April 23, around 20% of Mexico City’s Metro, bus and light rail stations will close. By closing some of the least busy stations, the mayor hopes to ease crowding at busier stations by increasing the frequency of trains and buses. 

Effective June 15, Mexico City has reduced the "Hoy no circula" program that prevents unnecessary vehicular movement during the COVID-19 pandemic.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: The Ministry of Health of Baja California Sur, "developed this weekend, a verification day in fixed establishments selling food in beach areas of the municipality of La Paz, with the objective of verifying the strong application of mandatory measures for the prevention of the new coronavirus." This includes: filling out a self-assessment card, implementation of sanitary filters in the entrances, reducing capacity to 30 percent and the distancing of tables, the disinfection, and cleaning of areas for the conservation and preparation of food, the monitoring of personal hygiene measures, the implementation of a disinfection program for common use areas, as well as compliance with specific provisions for the handling of groceries, as is the indication that all hot and cold foods must be covered from the kitchen, with a hood or with aluminum foil."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)

description:
From October 30 2020, the French national government has declared that anyone that is 11 years of age or over who boards a ship must wear a mask. Otherwise, access to the ship is refused.
 This obligation applies in publicly accessible areas of ferry terminals and waiting areas.
 This obligation does not apply to passengers who remain in their vehicles on board the ship or boat when authorized to do so
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions ridership of other forms of public transportation (please include details in the text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 18, 2021, the Hidalgo government moved the state to the colour red in the Semáforo System. Grocery stores, supermarkets, and flea markets will have a maximum capacity of 30% and must be closed before 6 PM. In addition, children under 5 years old may not enter, and those over 5 years old must wear a mask. Only 1 member per family may enter at a time. This will remain tentatively until at least January 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 18, 2021, the Hidalgo government moved the state to the colour red in the Semáforo System. Grocery stores, supermarkets, and flea markets will have a maximum capacity of 30% and must be closed before 6 PM. In addition, children under 5 years old may not enter, and those over 5 years old must wear a mask. Only 1 member per family may enter at a time. This will remain tentatively until at least January 31. UPDATE: Initially, the colour red in the Semáforo System for Hidalgo was to last at least until January 31st. The policy was extended and will continue until at least February 14th. Restrictions for grocery stores, supermarkets, and flea markets will remain the same.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
